Zosia Eastwood

Ways I See

�Ways I See� forms a poetry collection written by Patrycja Eastwood and designed by her daughter, Zosia Eastwood. Patrycja Eastwood emigrated to the UK from Poland in 1994 as a young adult. Despite her love of writing, she felt trapped between two languages. Years later, she now studies Creative Writing at university. 'Ways I See' symbolises the return to her favourite form of expression with confidence. The design of this book focuses on texture and feel, using by-hand practices such as letterpress to emphasise the importance of traditional print practices and finishes in the making of a meaningful publication.
